explanation: Funds are required to purchase a temporary modular secure facility at Eglin Air Force Base for | development and demonstration of emerging armament technologies. The secure facility is critical to enable systems engineering across multi-level security networks within a secure facility, robust Modeling & Simulation tools, hardware in-the-loop compliancy labs, and a continuous DevSecOps managed Government: Reference Architecture. This isa NEW START. The total cost of this requirement is $18.216 million, | which is funded within this request.

Funds are available because they are early to need due to C-130 Avionics Modernization Program developmental test delays. As a result, the program schedule and acquisition program baseline were updated moving Milestone C from FY 2023 to FY 2024. There are no other known program requirements for the funding at this time and no major impacts to the program.

budget_title: Congressional Action Approved by Sec Def
explanation: Funds are required to modify three C-32A and three C-40B aircraft with redundant commercial wideband satellite communications (SATCOM). This modification installs low earth orbital SATCOM high performance antennas under the existing radome for the C-32A and C-40B aircraft. The current single wideband SATCOM is affected by weather, aircraft performance and other factors that cannot be mitigated. This modification will ensure connectivity and reduce the likelihood of communication failure by adding redundant commercial wideband SATCOM for senior Executive Branch passengers. This requirement was identified during a 2022 assessment of Executive Airlift capabilities.

Funds are available because they are excess to need for the A-10 program due to the â€˜divestiture of aircraft. There are no other known requirements for the funding at this time and no major impacts to the program.

Funds are required to procure communication security (COMSEC) equipment to maintain COMSEC inventory in accordance with Committee on National Security Systems Instruction No. 4007. The Multi-Service COMSEC Working Group and U.S. Civil agencies shall identify equipment to be considered . for procurement during the program build and validation process, [tems to be procured are acceptable substitute items used against the same inventory objective or authorized acquisition objective in requirement computations. This is a base budget requirement.
Funds are available from the sale to foreign partners of three Simple Key Loaders, four fill | cables, and 26 KIK-30 RASKLs with transactions occurring between October 2021 and September 2022.
